verses.verse: When the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> heard<WH8085> of the fame<WH8088> of Solomon<WH8010> concerning the name<WH8034> of Yahweh,<WH3068> she came<WH935> to prove<WH5254> him with hard questions.<WH2420>

She came<WH935> to Jerusalem<WH3389> with a very<WH3966> great<WH3515> train,<WH2428> with camels<WH1581> that bore<WH5375> spices,<WH1314> and very<WH3966> much<WH7227> gold,<WH2091> and precious<WH3368> stones;<WH68> and when she had come<WH935> to Solomon,<WH8010> she talked<WH1696> with him of all that was in her heart.<WH3824>
Solomon<WH8010> told<WH5046> her all her questions:<WH1697> there was not anything<WH1697> hidden<WH5956> from the king<WH4428> which he didn't<WH5046> tell her.
When the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> had seen<WH7200> all the wisdom<WH2451> of Solomon,<WH8010> and the house<WH1004> that he had built,<WH1129>

and the food<WH3978> of his table,<WH7979> and the sitting<WH4186> of his servants,<WH5650> and the attendance<WH4612> of his ministers,<WH8334> and their clothing,<WH4403> and his cup bearers,<WH8248> and his ascent<WH5930> by which he went up<WH5927> to the house<WH1004> of Yahweh;<WH3068> there was no more spirit in her.<WH7307>
She said<WH559> to the king,<WH4428> "It was a true<WH571> report<WH1697> that I heard<WH8085> in my own land<WH776> of your acts,<WH1697> and of your wisdom.<WH2451>

However I didn't<WH539> believe the words,<WH1697> until I came,<WH935> and my eyes<WH5869> had seen<WH7200> it.<WH2677> Behold, the half was not told<WH5046> me!<WH2451> Your wisdom and prosperity<WH2896> exceed<WH3254> the fame<WH8052> which I heard.<WH8085>
Happy<WH835> are your men,<WH582> happy<WH835> are these your servants,<WH5650> who stand<WH5975> continually<WH8548> before<WH6440> you,<WH8085> who hear your wisdom.<WH2451>

Blessed<WH1288> is Yahweh<WH3068> your God,<WH430> who delighted<WH2654> in you,<WH5414> to set you on the throne<WH3678> of Israel.<WH3478> Because Yahweh<WH3068> loved<WH160> Israel<WH3478> forever,<WH5769> therefore made<WH7760> he you king,<WH4428> to do<WH6213> justice<WH4941> and righteousness.<WH6666>"

She gave<WH5414> the king<WH4428> one hundred<WH3967> twenty<WH6242> talents<WH3603> of gold,<WH2091> and of spices<WH1314> very<WH3966> great store,<WH7235> and precious<WH3368> stones.<WH68> There came<WH935> no more such<WH1931> abundance<WH7230> of spices<WH1314> as these which the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> gave<WH5414> to king<WH4428> Solomon.<WH8010>

The navy<WH590> also of Hiram,<WH2438> that brought<WH5375> gold<WH2091> from Ophir,<WH211> brought in<WH935> from Ophir<WH211> great<WH3966> plenty<WH7235> of almug<WH484> trees<WH6086> and precious<WH3368> stones.<WH68>

The king<WH4428> made<WH6213> of the almug<WH484> trees<WH6086> pillars<WH4552> for the house<WH1004> of Yahweh,<WH3068> and for the king<WH4428>'s house,<WH1004> harps<WH3658> also and stringed instruments<WH5035> for the singers:<WH7891> there came<WH935> no such almug<WH484> trees,<WH6086> nor were seen,<WH7200> to this day.<WH3117>

King<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> gave<WH5414> to the queen<WH4436> of Sheba<WH7614> all her desire,<WH2656> whatever she asked,<WH7592> besides that which Solomon<WH8010> gave<WH5414> her of his royal<WH4428> bounty.<WH3027> So she turned,<WH6437> and went<WH3212> to her own land,<WH776> she and her servants.<WH5650>
Now the weight<WH4948> of gold<WH2091> that came<WH935> to Solomon<WH8010> in one<WH259> year<WH8141> was six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> sixty<WH8346> - six<WH8337> talents<WH3603> of gold,<WH2091>

besides that which the traders<WH582> brought,<WH4536> and the traffic of the merchants,<WH7402> and of all the kings<WH4428> of the mixed<WH6153> people,<WH6346> and of the governors of the country.<WH776>

King<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> made<WH6213> two hundred<WH3967> bucklers<WH6793> of beaten<WH7820> gold;<WH2091> six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels of gold<WH2091> went<WH5927> to one<WH259> buckler.<WH6793>

he made three<WH7969> hundred<WH3967> shields<WH4043> of beaten<WH7820> gold;<WH2091> three<WH7969> minas<WH4488> of gold<WH2091> went<WH5927> to one<WH259> shield:<WH4043> and the king<WH4428> put<WH5414> them in the house<WH1004> of the forest<WH3293> of Lebanon.<WH3844>
Moreover the king<WH4428> made<WH6213> a great<WH1419> throne<WH3678> of ivory,<WH8127> and overlaid<WH6823> it with the finest<WH6338> gold.<WH2091>

There were six<WH8337> steps<WH4609> to the throne,<WH3678> and the top<WH7218> of the throne<WH3678> was round<WH5696> behind;<WH310> and there were stays<WH3027> on either side by the place<WH4725> of the seat,<WH7675> and two<WH8147> lions<WH738> standing<WH5975> beside<WH681> the stays.<WH3027>
Twelve<WH8147> lions<WH738> stood<WH5975> there on the one side and on the other on the six<WH8337> steps:<WH4609> there was nothing like<WH3651> it made<WH6213> in any kingdom.<WH4467>

All king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010>'s drinking<WH4945> vessels<WH3627> were of gold,<WH2091> and all the vessels<WH3627> of the house<WH1004> of the forest<WH3293> of Lebanon<WH3844> were of pure<WH5462> gold:<WH2091> none were of silver;<WH3701> it was nothing<WH3972> accounted<WH2803> of in the days<WH3117> of Solomon.<WH8010>

For the king<WH4428> had at sea<WH3220> a navy<WH590> of Tarshish<WH8659> with the navy<WH590> of Hiram:<WH2438> once<WH259> every three<WH7969> years<WH8141> came<WH935> the navy<WH590> of Tarshish,<WH8659> bringing<WH5375> gold,<WH2091> and silver,<WH3701> ivory,<WH8143> and apes,<WH6971> and peacocks.<WH8500>
So king<WH4428> Solomon<WH8010> exceeded<WH1431> all the kings<WH4428> of the earth<WH776> in riches<WH6239> and in wisdom.<WH2451>
All the earth<WH776> sought<WH1245> the presence of Solomon,<WH8010> to<WH6440> hear<WH8085> his wisdom,<WH2451> which God<WH430> had put<WH5414> in his heart.<WH3820>

They brought<WH935> every man<WH376> his tribute,<WH4503> vessels<WH3627> of silver,<WH3701> and vessels<WH3627> of gold,<WH2091> and clothing,<WH8008> and armor,<WH5402> and spices,<WH1314> horses,<WH5483> and mules,<WH6505> a rate<WH1697> year<WH8141> by year.<WH8141>

Solomon<WH8010> gathered together<WH622> chariots<WH7393> and horsemen:<WH6571> and he had a thousand<WH505> and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> chariots,<WH7393> and twelve<WH8147> thousand<WH505> horsemen,<WH6571> that he bestowed<WH5148> in the chariot<WH7393> cities,<WH5892> and with the king<WH4428> at Jerusalem.<WH3389>

The king<WH4428> made<WH5414> silver<WH3701> to be in Jerusalem<WH3389> as stones,<WH68> and cedars<WH730> made<WH5414> he to be as the sycamore trees<WH8256> that are in the lowland,<WH8219> for abundance.<WH7230>

The horses<WH5483> which Solomon<WH8010> had were brought<WH4161> out of Egypt;<WH4714> and the king<WH4428>'s merchants<WH5503> received<WH3947> them in droves,<WH4723> each drove<WH4723> at a price.<WH4242>

A chariot<WH4818> came up<WH5927> and went out<WH3318> of Egypt<WH4714> for six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> shekels of silver,<WH3701> and a horse<WH5483> for one hundred<WH3967> fifty;<WH2572> and so for all the kings<WH4428> of the Hittites,<WH2850> and for the kings<WH4428> of Syria,<WH758> they brought them out<WH3318> by their means.<WH3027>
